verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् |
विवस्वान्मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत् ||४-१||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
imaṃ vivasvate yogaṃ proktavānahamavyayam .
vivasvānmanave prāha manurikṣvākave.abravīt ..4-1..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
1. I taught this Imperishable YOGA to Vivasvan; Vivasvan taught it to Manu; Manu taught it to Ikshvaku.

verses.hn:
एवं परम्पराप्राप्तमिमं राजर्षयो विदुः |
स कालेनेह महता योगो नष्टः परन्तप ||४-२||
verses.en:
evaṃ paramparāprāptamimaṃ rājarṣayo viduḥ .
sa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣṭaḥ parantapa ..4-2..
verses.desc: 2. This knowledge, handed down thus in regular succession, the royal sages knew. This YOGA, by long lapse of time, has been lost here, O Parantapa (burner of the foes) .

verses.hn:
स एवायं मया तेऽद्य योगः प्रोक्तः पुरातनः |
भक्तोऽसि मे सखा चेति रहस्यं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ||४-३||
verses.en:
sa evāyaṃ mayā te.adya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ .
bhakto.asi me sakhā ceti rahasyaṃ hyetaduttamam ..4-3..
verses.desc: 3. That same ancient "YOGA" has been to-day taught to you by Me, for you are My devotee and My friend. This is a Supreme secret.

verses.hn:
अर्जुन उवाच |
अपरं भवतो जन्म परं जन्म विवस्वतः |
कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति ||४-४||
verses.en:
arjuna uvāca .
aparaṃ bhavato janma paraṃ janma vivasvataḥ .
kathametadvijānīyāṃ tvamādau proktavāniti ..4-4..
verses.desc:
Arjuna said:
4. Later was Your birth, and prior was the birth of Vivaswan (Sun) ; how am I to understand that You taught this YOGA in the beginning?

verses.hn:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
बहूनि मे व्यतीतानि जन्मानि तव चार्जुन |
तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप ||४-५||
verses.en:
śrībhagavānuvāca .
bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava cārjuna .
tānyahaṃ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṃ vettha parantapa ..4-5..
verses.desc:
The Blessed Lord said:
5. Many births of Mine have passed as well as yours, O Arjuna; I know them all but you
know them not, O Parantapa (scorcher of foes) .

verses.hn:
अजोऽपि सन्नव्ययात्मा भूतानामीश्वरोऽपि सन् |
प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय सम्भवाम्यात्ममायया ||४-६||
verses.en:
ajo.api sannavyayātmā bhūtānāmīśvaro.api san .
prakṛtiṃ svāmadhiṣṭhāya sambhavāmyātmamāyayā ..4-6..
verses.desc:
6. Though I am unborn and am of imperishable nature, and though I am the Lord of all
beings, yet, ruling over My own Nature, I take birth by My own MAYA.

verses.hn:
यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत |
अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदात्मानं सृजाम्यहम् ||४-७||
verses.en:
yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānirbhavati bhārata .
abhyutthānamadharmasya tadātmānaṃ sṛjāmyaham ..4-7..
verses.desc:
7. Whenever there is a decay of righteousness, O Bharata, and a rise of unrighteousness,
then I manifest Myself.

verses.hn:
परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम् |
धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे ||४-८||
verses.en:
paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṃ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām .
dharmasaṃsthāpanārthāya sambhavāmi yuge yuge ..4-8..
verses.desc:
8. For the protection of the good, for the destruction of the wicked and for the
establishment of rightenousness, I am born in every age.

verses.hn:
जन्म कर्म च मे दिव्यमेवं यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः |
त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन ||४-९||
verses.en:
janma karma ca me divyamevaṃ yo vetti tattvataḥ .
tyaktvā dehaṃ punarjanma naiti māmeti so.arjuna ..4-9..
verses.desc:
9. He who thus knows, in true light, My divine birth and action, having abandoned the
body, he is not born again; he comes to Me, O Arjuna.

verses.hn:
वीतरागभयक्रोधा मन्मया मामुपाश्रिताः |
बहवो ज्ञानतपसा पूता मद्भावमागताः ||४-१०||
verses.en:
vītarāgabhayakrodhā manmayā māmupāśritāḥ .
bahavo jñānatapasā pūtā madbhāvamāgatāḥ ..4-10..
verses.desc:
10. Freed from attachment, fear and anger, absorbed in Me, taking refuge in Me, purified
by the Fire-of-Knowledge, many have attained My Being.

verses.hn:
ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम् |
मम वर्त्मानुवर्तन्ते मनुष्याः पार्थ सर्वशः ||४-११||
verses.en:
ye yathā māṃ prapadyante tāṃstathaiva bhajāmyaham .
mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ ..4-11..
verses.desc:
11. It whatever way men approach Me, even so do I reward them; My path do men tread
in all ways, O son of Pritha.

verses.hn:
काङ्क्षन्तः कर्मणां सिद्धिं यजन्त इह देवताः |
क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा ||४-१२||
verses.en:
kāṅkṣantaḥ karmaṇāṃ siddhiṃ yajanta iha devatāḥ .
kṣipraṃ hi mānuṣe loke siddhirbhavati karmajā ..4-12..
verses.desc:
12. They who long for satisfaction from actions in this world, make sacrifices to the gods;
because satisfaction is quickly obtained from actions in the world-of-objects.

verses.hn:
चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः |
तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम् ||४-१३||
verses.en:
cāturvarṇyaṃ mayā sṛṣṭaṃ guṇakarmavibhāgaśaḥ .
tasya kartāramapi māṃ viddhyakartāramavyayam ..4-13..
verses.desc:
13. The fourfold-caste has been created by Me according to the differentiation of GUNA
an d KARMA; though I am the author thereof know Me as non-doer and immutable.

verses.hn:
न मां कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति न मे कर्मफले स्पृहा |
इति मां योऽभिजानाति कर्मभिर्न स बध्यते ||४-१४||
verses.en:
na māṃ karmāṇi limpanti na me karmaphale spṛhā .
iti māṃ yo.abhijānāti karmabhirna sa badhyate ..4-14..
verses.desc:
14. Actions do not taint Me, nor have I any desire for the fruits-of-actions. He who knows
Me thus is not bound by his actions.

verses.hn:
एवं ज्ञात्वा कृतं कर्म पूर्वैरपि मुमुक्षुभिः |
कुरु कर्मैव तस्मात्त्वं पूर्वैः पूर्वतरं कृतम् ||४-१५||
verses.en:
evaṃ jñātvā kṛtaṃ karma pūrvairapi mumukṣubhiḥ .
kuru karmaiva tasmāttvaṃ pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṃ kṛtam ..4-15..
verses.desc:
15. Having known this, the ancient seekers-after-freedom also performed action;
therefore, you too perform action, as did the ancients in the olden times.

verses.hn:
किं कर्म किमकर्मेति कवयोऽप्यत्र मोहिताः |
तत्ते कर्म प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ||४-१६||
verses.en:
kiṃ karma kimakarmeti kavayo.apyatra mohitāḥ .
tatte karma pravakṣyāmi yajjñātvā mokṣyase.aśubhāt ..4-16..
verses.desc:
16. What is action? What is inaction? As to this even the "wise" are deluded. Therefore, I
shall teach you "action" (the nature of action and inaction) , knowing which, you shall be
liberated from the evil (of SAMSARA --- the wheel of birth and death) .

verses.hn:
कर्मणो ह्यपि बोद्धव्यं बोद्धव्यं च विकर्मणः |
अकर्मणश्च बोद्धव्यं गहना कर्मणो गतिः ||४-१७||
verses.en:
karmaṇo hyapi boddhavyaṃ boddhavyaṃ ca vikarmaṇaḥ .
akarmaṇaśca boddhavyaṃ gahanā karmaṇo gatiḥ ..4-17..
verses.desc:
17. For verily (the true nature) of "right action" should be known; also (that) of
"forbidden (or unlawful) action" and of "inaction" ; imponderable is the nature (path) of
action.

verses.hn:
कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः |
स बुद्धिमान्मनुष्येषु स युक्तः कृत्स्नकर्मकृत् ||४-१८||
verses.en:
karmaṇyakarma yaḥ paśyedakarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ .
sa buddhimānmanuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsnakarmakṛt ..4-18..
verses.desc:
18. He who recognises inaction in action and action in inaction is wise among men; he is
a YOGI and a true performer of all actions.

verses.hn:
यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः कामसङ्कल्पवर्जिताः |
ज्ञानाग्निदग्धकर्माणं तमाहुः पण्डितं बुधाः ||४-१९||
verses.en:
yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāmasaṅkalpavarjitāḥ .
jñānāgnidagdhakarmāṇaṃ tamāhuḥ paṇḍitaṃ budhāḥ ..4-19..
verses.desc:
19. Whose undertakings are all devoid of desires and purposes, and whose actions have
been burnt by the Fire-of-Knowledge, him the "wise" call a Sage.

verses.hn:
त्यक्त्वा कर्मफलासङ्गं नित्यतृप्तो निराश्रयः |
कर्मण्यभिप्रवृत्तोऽपि नैव किञ्चित्करोति सः ||४-२०||
verses.en:
tyaktvā karmaphalāsaṅgaṃ nityatṛpto nirāśrayaḥ .
karmaṇyabhipravṛtto.api naiva kiñcitkaroti saḥ ..4-20..
verses.desc:
20. Having abandoned attachment to the fruits-of-action, ever-content, depending on
nothing, he does not do anything, though engaged in actions.

verses.hn:
निराशीर्यतचित्तात्मा त्यक्तसर्वपरिग्रहः |
शारीरं केवलं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ||४-२१||
verses.en:
nirāśīryatacittātmā tyaktasarvaparigrahaḥ .
śārīraṃ kevalaṃ karma kurvannāpnoti kilbiṣam ..4-21..
verses.desc:
21. Without hope, with the mind and Self controlled, having abandoned all possessions,
doing mere bodily action, he incurs no sin.

verses.hn:
यदृच्छालाभसन्तुष्टो द्वन्द्वातीतो विमत्सरः |
समः सिद्धावसिद्धौ च कृत्वापि न निबध्यते ||४-२२||
verses.en:
yadṛcchālābhasantuṣṭo dvandvātīto vimatsaraḥ .
samaḥ siddhāvasiddhau ca kṛtvāpi na nibadhyate ..4-22..
verses.desc:
22. Content with what comes to him without effort, free from the pairs-of-opposites and
envy, even-minded in success and failure, though acting he is not bound.

verses.hn:
गतसङ्गस्य मुक्तस्य ज्ञानावस्थितचेतसः |
यज्ञायाचरतः कर्म समग्रं प्रविलीयते ||४-२३||
verses.en:
gatasaṅgasya muktasya jñānāvasthitacetasaḥ .
yajñāyācarataḥ karma samagraṃ pravilīyate ..4-23..
verses.desc:
23. Of one who is devoid of attachment, who is liberated, whose mind is established in
knowledge, who acts for the sake of sacrifice, all his actions are dissolved.

verses.hn:
ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् |
ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना ||४-२४||
verses.en:
brahmārpaṇaṃ brahma havirbrahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutam .
brahmaiva tena gantavyaṃ brahmakarmasamādhinā ..4-24..
verses.desc:
24. BRAHMAN is the oblation; BRAHMAN is the clarified butter, etc. , constituting the
offerings; by BRAHMAN is the oblation poured into the fire of BRAHMAN; BRAHMAN
verily shall be reached by him who always sees BRAHMAN in all actions.

verses.hn:
दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते |
ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति ||४-२५||
verses.en:
daivamevāpare yajñaṃ yoginaḥ paryupāsate .
brahmāgnāvapare yajñaṃ yajñenaivopajuhvati ..4-25..
verses.desc:
25. Some YOGIS perform sacrifice to DEVAS alone (DEVA-YAJNA) ; while others offer
"sacrifice" as sacrifice by the Self, in the Fire of BRAHMAN (BRAHMA-YAJNA) .

verses.hn:
श्रोत्रादीनीन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति |
शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति ||४-२६||
verses.en:
śrotrādīnīndriyāṇyanye saṃyamāgniṣu juhvati .
śabdādīnviṣayānanya indriyāgniṣu juhvati ..4-26..
verses.desc:
26. Some again offer hearing and other senses as sacrifice in the fires-of-restraint; others
offer sound and other objects of sense as sacrifice in the fires-of-the-senses.

verses.hn:
सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे |
आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते ||४-२७||
verses.en:
sarvāṇīndriyakarmāṇi prāṇakarmāṇi cāpare .
ātmasaṃyamayogāgnau juhvati jñānadīpite ..4-27..
verses.desc:
27. Others again sacrifice all the functions of the senses and the functions of the breath
(vital energy) in the fire of the YOGA of self-restraint, kindled by knowledge.

verses.hn:
द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे |
स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः ||४-२८||
verses.en:
dravyayajñāstapoyajñā yogayajñāstathāpare .
svādhyāyajñānayajñāśca yatayaḥ saṃśitavratāḥ ..4-28..
verses.desc:
28. Others again offer wealth, austerity and YOGA as sacrifice, while the ascetics of self-
restraint and rigid vows offer study of scriptures and knowledge as sacrifice.

verses.hn:
अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे |
प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः ||४-२९||
verses.en:
apāne juhvati prāṇaṃ prāṇe.apānaṃ tathāpare .
prāṇāpānagatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāmaparāyaṇāḥ ..4-29..
verses.desc:
29. Others offer as sacrifice the out-going breath in the in-coming, and the in-coming in
the out-going, restraining the courses of the out-going and in-coming breaths, solely
absorbed in the restraint of breath.

verses.hn:
अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति |
सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः ||४-३०||
verses.en:
apare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇānprāṇeṣu juhvati .
sarve.apyete yajñavido yajñakṣapitakalmaṣāḥ ..4-30..
verses.desc:
30. Others, with well-regulated diet, offer vital-airs in the Vital-Air. All these are knowers
of sacrifice, whose sins are destroyed by sacrifice.

verses.hn:
यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् |
नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम ||४-३१||
verses.en:
yajñaśiṣṭāmṛtabhujo yānti brahma sanātanam .
nāyaṃ loko.astyayajñasya kuto.anyaḥ kurusattama ..4-31..
verses.desc:
31. The eaters of the nectar --- remnant of the sacrifice --- go to the Eternal BRAHMAN.
Even this world is not for the non-performer of sacrifice; how then the other (world) , O
best of the Kurus?

verses.hn:
एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे |
कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे ||४-३२||
verses.en:
evaṃ bahuvidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhe .
karmajānviddhi tānsarvānevaṃ jñātvā vimokṣyase ..4-32..
verses.desc:
32. Thus innumerable sacrifices lie spread out before BRAHMAN --- (literally at the
mouth or face of BRAHMAN ) --- Know them all as born of action, and thus knowing,
you shall be liberated.

verses.hn:
श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप |
सर्वं कर्माखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते ||४-३३||
verses.en:
śreyāndravyamayādyajñājjñānayajñaḥ parantapa .
sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate ..4-33..
verses.desc:
33. Superior is "knowledge-sacrifice" to "Sacrifice-with-objects, " O Parantapa. All
actions in their entirety, O Partha, culminate in Knowledge.

verses.hn:
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया |
उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः ||४-३४||
verses.en:
tadviddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā .
upadekṣyanti te jñānaṃ jñāninastattvadarśinaḥ ..4-34..
verses.desc:
34. Know that by long prostration, by question, and service, the "wise" who have
realised the Truth will instruct you in (that) 'Knowledge. '

verses.hn:
यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव |
येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि (var अशेषाणि) ||४-३५||
verses.en:
yajjñātvā na punarmohamevaṃ yāsyasi pāṇḍava .
yena bhūtānyaśeṣāṇi drakṣyasyātmanyatho mayi ..4-35..
verses.desc:
35. Knowing that, you shall not, O Pandava, again get deluded like this; and by that, you
shall see all beings in your Self, and also in Me.

verses.hn:
अपि चेदसि पापेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः पापकृत्तमः |
सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि ||४-३६||
verses.en:
api cedasi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpakṛttamaḥ .
sarvaṃ jñānaplavenaiva vṛjinaṃ santariṣyasi ..4-36..
verses.desc:
36. Even if you are the most sinful of all sinners, yet you shall verily cross all sins by the
raft of 'Knowledge. '

verses.hn:
यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन |
ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा ||४-३७||
verses.en:
yathaidhāṃsi samiddho.agnirbhasmasātkurute.arjuna .
jñānāgniḥ sarvakarmāṇi bhasmasātkurute tathā ..4-37..
verses.desc:
37. As the blazing fire reduces fuel to ashes, O Arjuna, so does the Fire-of-Knowledge
reduce all actions to ashes.

verses.hn:
न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते |
तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति ||४-३८||
verses.en:
na hi jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitramiha vidyate .
tatsvayaṃ yogasaṃsiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati ..4-38..
verses.desc:
38. Certainly, there is no purifier in this world like 'Knowledge. ' He who is himself
perfected in YOGA finds it in the Self in time.

verses.hn:
श्रद्धावाँल्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः |
ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||४-३९||
verses.en:
śraddhāvā.Nllabhate jñānaṃ tatparaḥ saṃyatendriyaḥ .
jñānaṃ labdhvā parāṃ śāntimacireṇādhigacchati ..4-39..
verses.desc:
39. The man who is full of faith, who is devoted to It, and who has subdued the senses,
obtains (this) 'Knowledge' ; and having obtained 'Knowledge, ' ere long he goes to the
Supreme Peace.

verses.hn:
अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति |
नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः ||४-४०||
verses.en:
ajñaścāśraddadhānaśca saṃśayātmā vinaśyati .
nāyaṃ loko.asti na paro na sukhaṃ saṃśayātmanaḥ ..4-40..
verses.desc:
40. The ignorant, the faithless, the doubting-self goes to destruction; there is neither this
world, nor the other, nor happiness for the doubter.

verses.hn:
योगसंन्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् |
आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ||४-४१||
verses.en:
yogasaṃnyastakarmāṇaṃ jñānasañchinnasaṃśayam .
ātmavantaṃ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya ..4-41..
verses.desc:
41. He who has renounced actions by YOGA, whose doubts are rent asunder by
'Knowledge, ' who is self-possessed, actions do not bind him, O Dhananjaya.

verses.hn:
तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानासिनात्मनः |
छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ||४-४२||
verses.en:
tasmādajñānasambhūtaṃ hṛtsthaṃ jñānāsinātmanaḥ .
chittvainaṃ saṃśayaṃ yogamātiṣṭhottiṣṭha bhārata ..4-42..
verses.desc:
42. Therefore with the sword-of-Knowledge, cut asunder the doubt-of-the-Self, born of
'ignorance, ' residing in your heart, and take refuge in "YOGA. " Arise, O Bharata.

verses.hn:
ॐ तत्सदिति श्रीमद्भगवद्गीतासूपनिषत्सु
ब्रह्मविद्यायां योगशास्त्रे श्रीकृष्णार्जुनसंवादे
ज्ञानकर्मसंन्यासयोगो नाम चतुर्थोऽध्यायः ||४||
verses.en: OM tatsaditi śrīmadbhagavadgītāsūpaniṣatsu brahmavidyāyāṃ yogaśāstre śrīkṛṣṇārjunasaṃvāde jñānakarmasaṃnyāsayogo nāma caturtho.adhyāyaḥ ..4-43..
verses.desc:
Thus, in the UPANISHADS of the glorious Bhagawad Geeta, in the Science of the Eternal, in the scripture of YOGA , in the dialogue between Sri Krishna and Arjuna, the fourth discourse ends entitled:
THE YOGA OF RENUNCIATION OF ACTION IN KNOWLEDGE
